channel.title: Projects on Julien Pascal
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Julien Pascal

item.title: The D-CAPM: Reconciling Consumption and Asset Pricing
item.description: This is a joint project with Tyler Abbot.

item.title: Labor Tax in a Dynamic Search-and-Matching Model
item.description: We develop a theoretical framework to evaluate the contribution of different payroll tax schedules to the cyclical behavior of the distribution of individual income shocks along the business cycle. We build a dynamic search-and-matching model of the labor market featuring heterogeneous workers, aggregate and idiosyncratic shocks and a non-linear payroll tax schedule. We solve the model using perturbation techniques developed in Reiter (2009) and Winberry (2016). We estimate the model on Italian administrative data for the period 1980-2012 and use our estimated framework to quantitatively evaluate how different payroll tax schedules can alter the cyclicality of income risk for different types of workers. This is a joint project with Nicol√≤ Dalvit.
